column4: If I want to do a clean 9.04 install with a 8.10 CD, all I need to do is run update in live session before install, correct?
You will not be able to do a 9.04 install with an 8.10 CD.
even after updating ubiquity?
:( ok thanks
I did not understand your original question.
Please restate your original question.

ubiquity is the installer for ubuntu. if I an running a liveCD and update the repository, and update ubiquity, then running the installer would install 9.04. the live CD is just a regular install + ubiquity and squashfs. right?
I don't know, but sounds interesting.  Did  you stay at a Holiday Inn last night?
pretty close...
:)   (was a feeble attempt at humor on my part).
I am feeling about that special right now. I havn't been home in 3 days, doing ubuntu tech support  :)
is that too much love?
Yes, it is!  ;o)
A friends father runs a web hosting company, and has been a IIS tech for years, and finally decided he hates the problems enough to completly switch over to Ubuntu
so was helping with that
though personally, I have never seen a IIS setup so well maintained / setup
I'll bet it's hard to utangle that many years of MS mindset and stuff what's left into *nix mindset
If he's that good, he'll be good with Linux.
That's what I figure
But one thing is for sure, it will be easier to maintain his Linux server, once he get's the hang of it.
he stated that as his #1 reason for switching.
